Exenay (eXeNAy)

Exenay is a 2D engine, based on XNA, allowing you to easily create games without having to worry about rolling your own engine. No need to worry about implementing your own sprite objects, position vectors, sprite sheet animation manager, drawing methods, and much more.

Exenay provides you with a range of features not provided by XNA, it also simplifies many of the features provided by XNA by directing it more towards use in 2D games.

Some of the features Exenay includes:

  • Sprite objects
    • implemented functions to operate flipping, scaling, and rotation.
  • Animation objects
    • manages single animation sprite sheets
    • adjustable sheet size and animation speed
  • Bounding Box collision detection
  • Gamestate management
    • Gamestate saving (Serialize gamestate to disk)


Future features(hopeful goals):

  • GUI objects
  • better collision detection
  • Easier effects(shaders)
  • lighting library(wrap krypton)


Exenay is currently under development, no stable version available
